name: Small Pot
description: The smallest pot we offer, approximately 2.5 inches tall

name: Medium Pot
description: The 2nd largest pot we offer, approximately 6 inches tall

name: Large Pot
description: The largest pot we offer, approximately 10 inches tall

name: 3 Pot Bundle
description: A bundle of the small, medium, and largest pot

name: Bag of Fertilizer
description: A 30lb bag of fertilizer

name: Bag of Mulch
description: A 20lb bag of mulch

name: Bag of Soil
description: A 100lb bag of soil

name: Bag of Grass Seed
description: A 30lb bag of fertilizer

name: Azalea
description: A pink flowering shrub that blooms in the spring

name: Begonia
description: A perennial flower with over 2000 species, native to the most subtropics

name: Blackeyed Susan
description: Found in the eastern and central portions of the United States, these plants can get 1 - 3 feet tall

name: Carnation
description: Commonly refered to as the Pink Clove, this flower found in the Mediterranean and has been cultivated for over 2000 years

name: Daisy
description: A white european wildflower with a yellow center

name: Daffodil
description: A yelloe trumpet shaped flower which blooms in the spring, native to Europe

name: Heliotrope
description: A purple colored flower which is often found by scent first then sight

name: Lily
description: A bulbous flower which prefers loamy soil and good drainage

name: Rose
description: Native to the temperate regions of the nothern hemisphere, comes in many colors

name: Tulip
description: Large and colorful, blooms in the spring, has a color spot near the base

name: Arborvitae
description: A tall, dense, slow growing shrub perfect for the sides of houses

name: Boxwood
description: A deep green, pointed, long shrub native to asia, europe, and africa

name: Forsythia
description: A yellow shrub native to asia with rough brown bark

name: English Ivy
description: A standard ivy plant, often refered to as Hedera Helix found in Canada, used in some medecines

name: Cactus
description: A spikey plant found in many deserts, requires very little water

name: Aloe
description: A plant used for burn relief

name: Oscularia
description: A pink flowering succulent native to south africa, thrives in arid rocky climates

name: Shovel
description: A metal tool use to dig holes and move soil

name: Hoe
description: A metal tool used to shape soil, remove weeds, harvest root crops, and dig narrow tunnels

name: Cultivator
description: A spiked roller which mixes loose soil, ideal for small beds and vegetable gardens

name: Watering can
description: A 20fl oz metal water can

name: Gloves
description: A pair of gardening gloves
